alert.note: Alert for Natrona (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 4:37PM MDT until June 29 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Natrona. * WHEN...Until 830 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 434 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is likely to cause urban and small stream flooding. Radar estimates between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Matheson Creek, Soda Lake Draw, Wolf Creek, Poison Spider Creek, Sixmile Draw, Casper Creek, Iron Creek, North Platte River and Garden Creek. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Southwestern Casper, Mills, Red Butte, Paradise Valley, Emigrant Gap, Fort Caspar Campground, Casper-Natrona County International Airport, Central Wyoming Fairgrounds and Casper Mountain.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service.
